format: A data frame with 322 observations of major league players on the following 20 variables.

parameters.CWalks: Number of walks during his career
parameters.CAtBat: Number of times at bat during his career
parameters.Division:
A factor with levels E and W
indicating player's division at the end of 1986
parameters.CRBI: Number of runs batted in during his career
parameters.RBI: Number of runs batted in in 1986
parameters.CRuns: Number of runs during his career
parameters.CHits: Number of hits during his career
parameters.Years: Number of years in the major leagues
parameters.NewLeague:
A factor with levels A and N
indicating player's league at the beginning of 1987
parameters.League:
A factor with levels A and N
indicating player's league at the end of 1986
parameters.AtBat: Number of times at bat in 1986
parameters.CHmRun: Number of home runs during his career
parameters.Salary: 1987 annual salary on opening day in thousands of  dollars

reference:
This dataset was taken from the StatLib library which is
maintained at Carnegie Mellon University. This is part of the data
that was used in the 1988 ASA Graphics Section Poster Session. The
salary data  were  originally  from  Sports Illustrated, April 20,
1987. The 1986 and career statistics were obtained from The 1987 Baseball
Encyclopedia Update published by Collier  Books,  Macmillan
Publishing  Company, New York.
title: Baseball Data
description:
Description
Major League Baseball Data from the 1986 and 1987 seasons.
